Module Simulator
Package kin.invkin.downhill

Class InversePosFunction

java.lang.Object
kin.invkin.downhill.InversePosFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
DownhillFunction
public class InversePosFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements DownhillFunction

A function to be minimized for inverse kinematics computation to reach a certain component position with the help of servo angles and linear motor lengths.

A developer usally does not instantiate such an object explicitly.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

    • mapToArgument

      public double[] mapToArgument​(double[] x)
      Description copied from interface: DownhillFunction
      Map an argument to an argument in the definition set. This means, if a certain x[i] is not in the allowed limit, it is mapped to the nearest allowed value.
      Specified by:
      mapToArgument in interface DownhillFunction
      Parameters:
      x - argument
      Returns:
      argument in the definition set, may be x, if x is in the definition set
